Aditya's NCShield.Org: Free Face Shields for Frontliners!

Triangle Senior Makes 3D-Printed Face Shields for Healthcare Workers

TMSA High School Student Aditya Shankar provides free face shields to as many healthcare and essential workers as he can in the RTP area.

He has already provided more than 150 face shields free of charge to those who risk their lives on the frontline to keep us safe against the pandemic.

When the lack of adequate PPE for frontline healthcare workers arose as a crisis, Aditya wanted to be a part of the solution and started to use his resources and skills for good.

Aditya has managed to produce face shields at a cost of $1.65. He needs your help to do more.

You can reach him at ncshield20@gmail.com or visit ncshield.org

For more information on all vaccine requirements for 12th graders in North Carolina, go to www.immunize.nc.gov/schools.

Please bear with us. Stay safe and strong!

Ben Karaduman
Superintendent

Just a friendly reminder that students will be able to return to school between the hours of 9am and 2pm beginning tomorrow to empty out lockers and return materials and chromebooks. Thursday, May 21: 7th and 10th graders

We look forward to seeing you then! Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions!

Some of our students qualified for the South Atlantic Region CRCC finals at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond over the weekend. The team was the only representative from NC. CRCC is a cyber robotics coding competition?

CRCC is a groundbreaking online robotics competition that engages students in coding. Schools can compete and involve students through gaming and competition in STEM, coding and tech literacy. No previous experience is necessary, everyone can participate. CRCC is cloud-based, can be accessed from any computer and uses a simulation of virtual 3D Robots that perform complex tasks and missions. By learning to program, planning and strategizing the virtual robot to participate, students will compete within their class, grade, school, district and state to win stages and progress to the finals.

Think you may be interested in CRCC? See Mr. Ilbay for more information! TMSA Public Charter Schools

post_text: Select students from Mrs. Bagnell's PLTW Biomedical class had the opportunity to attend the annual Gathering of Friends luncheon for earlier.org. whose mission has worked and focused solely on the earlier detection of breast cancer. The objective of the organization is to direct as many funds as possible, as quickly as possible, to the research. When Earlier.org achieves its clearly defined mission to fund research leading to successful earlier detection, the organization can willingly and thankfully close its doors. Scott Hamilton was the keynote speaker. He talked about "getting off the bench and going for what you are passionate about." Students also learned about the five grants, totaling $199,844, that earlier.org funded this year.
